content.description: Shares start with Bee's Tongue, but continues up right through larger corner.
Start left of tree. Climb past 2 bolts on face to roofy dihedral that takes gear, and reach out from under roof to finish at chains on upper lip. Awaiting free ascent without tree knob.
content.protection: Mixed, 2 bolts and gear (0.75 & 1.5-inch), bolted anchors

content.description: Meaning Hawk in Cherokee named in respect to the Native Americans who once watched over this land, who have rights to the water source nearby “Till the moon burns out”. This slightly overhanging warm-up will get your head right for getting high up on a cliff. Follow the obvious crack to start,  slightly right, then jump over and straight-up with solid placements all the way. Easy top rope back-up for the beginning trad leader.
content.protection: Standard rack to a tree anchor

content.description: Climb left out past bolts out from under the steep overhang then sling branches up to tree anchor.
content.protection: 2 bolts, tree sling, to tree anchor.

content.description: Layback the obvious dihedral roof crack with sparse feet, and then huck high to easier terrain.  At the Town’s request, this route is dedicated to the crew of stewards that helped to open this awesome resource.
content.location: Obvious trad line between Starry Eyed and Feelin Good

climbs.name: See Line Woman
climbs.fa: Bryan Miller, Lauren Striefel, Jonathan & Alexandra Gerst, Kevin Junge, Mike Reardon (2019)

content.description:
Even Nina Simone (Tryon native) would like this one. Nice moderate clip up on big holds. Start on a slightly dirty section of rock with easy climbing past the first bolt. Great edges lead past four more bolts to an anchor on the right.

Also possible to flake tope rope to right to pull through the steeper, bouldery sections of the rock face and to the right of the upper roof where a Southern Devil Scorpion has been spotted!

First ascent party initially waylaid by mushroomed sleeve on 10-mm metric bolt in ⅜-in drill bit hole.  Although this resulted in less bolts to finish the route and a brief runout, the runout section is only 5.6 and bolts are just where you need them.  High first clip.
content.location: Left most route at the West Cliff.

climbs.name: Sasquashem!
climbs.fa: Jonathan Gerst and Kevin Junge, May 2020

content.description:
Two starts possible with this route- up the arete to bolt (climber's left) or through dihedral to bolt (climber's right), and then 2 more bolts up steep wall to bolted anchor on 2nd tier.

Don't squash the kids Kevin!
Go up left from first bolt on Cougar Leverage. Slab your way up to steep mantle crux with hidden crimp and jugs near finish.

If you love sketchy pro on over-hanging dihedral cracks, start in same corner as Pizza to Pearls, but skip the first 2 bolts with big cams, traverse right under pizza roof, and join the next dihedral within upper section of Trees Got Your Back.
content.protection: Standard rack.  Shares bolted anchors with Trees Got Your Back.

climbs.name: Pizza Pearl
climbs.fa: Jonathan Gerst, Kevin Junge, Bryan Miller, Lauren Striefel (2019)

content.description: Fantastically funky dihedral roof crack route that passes left of the overhanging pizza wedge, steps back hard left onto the diving board and then passes by what appears to be a petrified oyster.  While the oyster (mica book) may not contain a treasure inside, even when wet this route is certainly a pearl to admire.
content.location: Starts midway up the gully under the big roof.

content.description: Great little top rope to rig up for the kiddos.  Walk around or free solo to anchors.
content.location: Further right route on the lower main west wall.

climbs.name: Music Seeping Through
climbs.fa: Bryan Haslam, Jonathan Gerst, Kevin Junge (2019)

content.description: Pure ledgy face climb with fun moves and a challenging vertical finish.
content.location: Farther right route on the slab wall. Left of steep gully.

climbs.name: Morris' Arete
climbs.fa: Kevin Junge, Jonathan Gerst, Kyle Sox (2019)

content.description: Climb the obvious arete, but don’t let the big holds on Mama’s Back Crack to the right lead you astray.  Balance on the tip of the arete to find sufficient holds and high feet. Named after Tryon Town mascot, Morris the gigantic toy horse.
content.protection: 5 bolts, shares bolted anchors with Mama’s Back Crack

content.description: Mostly big holds on an overhanging rock face with wild and unexpected knee bars.
content.protection: Sport. 3 bolts, anchors.   Cam before anchors to avoid upper runout in easier terrain.
content.location: Currently the further right route at the main West Cliff.

climbs.name: Mamma’s Back Crack
climbs.fa: Lauren Striefel,  Bryan Miller, Jonathan & Alexandra Gerst, Kevin Junge, Mike Reardon (2019)

content.description: Great crack just right of the arete. One of the few climbs on Melrose Mountain that takes solid pro. Located at the lowest point of rock and either take on a roof move to the right of the low point that is hard 5.10, or climb an easier slab on the left and slightly uphill. Sequential moves up a jagged crack lead to an anchor. Easy to TR access as well.
content.protection: Standard Rack (go passive with stoppers and tri-cams!) to bolted anchors

climbs.name: J's Junction
climbs.fa: Jonathan Gerst, Jordan Braswell, and Kevin Junge, May 2020

content.description: Low first bolt protects hard move right off the ground, but main crux section is pulling roof past 2nd and 3rd bolts.  Huge horizontal move at second bolt is well protected.  Clipping 3rd bolt is tough!  Joins with Wanderer's Way past 4th bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts on J's Junction to upper 2 bolts on Wanderer's Way to fixed anchors.
content.location: Between Wanderer's Way and Monkey Knee Bars

climbs.name: Feelin' Good
climbs.fa: Mike Reardon, Jonathan Gerst, Bryan Miller, Kevin Junge (2019)

content.description: Another Nina Simone classic and an initial 35’ jug haul at its finest!  In-cut jugs on an overhanging wall leads past 4 bolts to a 5.8 runout to 5th bolt and anchors.

This route starts right of the tree, passes 2 bolts, and then traverses left at second bolt to climb face to pass ledge to anchors.  Ascend without using the tree except to sling the Y (i.e. floss the crotch) at ~25 ft.
content.protection: Sport, 2 bolts then sling the tree crotch at ~25ft, bolted anchors

content.description: Move past 4th bolt is crux.

climbs.name: Cabin Fever
climbs.fa: Jonathan Gerst, Kevin Junge, Eric Johnston, Mike Reardon, March 2020

content.description: Great slab. Crux/route veers left to mono pocket just past 4th bolt, but if the bolt positioning (sorry it's wonky!) or crux trips you out, you can veer right to dab off easier moves from Music Seeping Through.

Start at a short crack section next to a small tree, then step up a slab to a short overhanging section just left of a wide crack. A #4 in the crack protects the overhang (clip it short to stay off the ledge, or sling it long to reduce drag, dealer's choice). Pull the overhang through a notch, then move left up a fun slab with gear to a ~7 inch tree.

Walk off climber's right.
content.protection: Light rack--#4 useful to protect overhang up high, small TCU useful after overhang.
content.location: Obvious crack next to small tree, between Monkey Knee Bars and Sasquashem'.

content.description: Slightly overhanging to vertical face.  Big reaches to big holds. Named after stop motion capture of renegade ostrich at cliff base that likely escaped from nearby exotic animal farm.
content.protection: Std rack (shares anchor with Mama’s Back Crack)

climbs.name: Bee's Tongue
climbs.fa: Jonathan Gerst, Kevin Junge, Bryan Haslam (2019)

content.description: Shares start with Wanderer's Way but splits out left under steep roof and up through small notch.  Trends back right to bolted anchor approx. 10-ft below chossy cliff top.
